Introduction to |asm|/Advanced WAF Behavioral DoS¶

F5 Application Security Manager (ASM), Advanced WAF, and DDoS Hybrid Defender products all include advanced functionality for defending L7DoS attacks. In this self-paced lab, attendees will have an opportunity to explore one component of the overall feature set, L7 Behavioral DoS (BaDOS), leverage BaDOS to mitigate various L7DoS attacks, and examine the built-in reporting and monitoring functions provided by ASM. At the conclusion of the lab, the attendee will have comfort in the basics of BaDOS, how the feature is deployed, and the types of attacks it can be used to mitigate.

Expected time to complete: 45-60 minutes

Getting Started

Please follow the instructions provided by the instructor to start your lab and access your jump host.

Note

All work for this lab will be performed exclusively from the Linux Workstation jumphost. No installation or interaction with your local system is required.

Lab Topology¶

Lab Components¶

The following table lists VLANS, IP Addresses and Credentials for all components:

Component Description VLAN/IP Address(es) Credentials
bigip01 |f5| Virtual Edition v13.1: |ltm|, |asm|
  • Management: 10.1.1.245
  • Internal: 10.1.20.245
  • External: 10.1.10.245
 admin/admin
bigip02 |f5| Virtual Edition v13.1: - |ltm|, |asm|
  • Management: 10.1.1.246
  • Internal: 10.1.20.246
  • External: 10.1.10.246
 admin/admin
Ubuntu Linux Workstation Lab Jumpstation
  • eth0: 10.1.1.51
  • eth1: 10.1.10.51
 f5student/f5DEMOs4u
Kali Linux Workstation Lab Attack Workstation
  • eth0: 10.1.10.60
 root/f5DEMOs4u

Lab Environments

  1. Open a browser and go to `http://training.f5agililty.com/<lab

    number>/X <http://training.f5agililty.com/%3clab%20number%3e/X>`__ (where X is your student number)

    1. Look for the xubuntu-jumpbox-vxx. You will use the xubuntu jumpbox for all the labs. (see below)

    2. You can click on RDP to RDP to the Xubuntu jumpbox or you can select the CONSOLE link and access the jumpbox via your browser.

    The CONSOLE link requires you turn off pop-up blockers.

  2. Open the Chrome browser and log into the BIG-IP GUI to verify the BIG-IP is up.

    1. Go to https://10.1.1.245
      1. User: admin
      2. Password: admin

  3. Now you will perform an initial configuration via command line.

    1. Open a terminal window from the taskbar at the bottom.
      1. Log in to the BIG-IP using the command: ssh root@10.1.1.245
      2. The password is default.
      3. At the BIG-IP prompt, enter tmsh
        1. This will place you in the BIG-IP command line mode.
    2. In your browser, open then the Lab Guides link on the bookmarks bar in a new tab/window.
    3. Open the AdvWAF Base Setup.txt file and review the commands.
    4. Copy all the commands between # BEGIN COPY - Lab prep and # END COPY - Lab prep
    5. Paste the commands into the terminal window at the tmsh prompt.
    6. The BIG-IP will take several minutes to come back online.
      1. Good time for a bathroom break. Smoke ‘em if you got ‘em.

  4. Verify the virtual server and web site are up and running.

    1. Go to Local Traffic >> Network Map. There should be two virtual servers and all should be available (green).
    2. Open up the Firefox browser. Go to http://hackazon.f5demo.com and https://hackazon.f5demo.com
